job.name: FTPS

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: PROTECTION_LEVEL
variable.description: Protection level of the data channel in a FTPS communication. The default setting is Private.

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

variable.name: CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_AUTHENTICATION
variable.description: If true, enable client certificate authentication

variable.name: CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_AUTHENTICATION_HANDLER
variable.description: A hidden variable that allows to have a dynamic form for input parameters, i.e., variables will appear/disappear dynamically depending on the value of variable CERTIFICATE_AUTHENTICATION

variable.name: CLIENT_CERTIFICATE_CRED
variable.description: Client SSL certificate

variable.name: CLIENT_PRIVATE_KEY_CRED
variable.description: The private key

variable.name: CLIENT_PRIVATE_KEY_ALIAS
variable.description: The alias of the key to use, may be null in which case the first key entry alias is used

variable.name: CLIENT_PRIVATE_KEY_PASSWORD
variable.description: The password to protect the key

variable.name: SERVER_CERTIFICATE_VERIFICATION
variable.description: If true, enable server SSL certificate verification

variable.name: SERVER_CERTIFICATE_HANDLER
variable.description: A hidden variable that allows to have a dynamic form for input parameters, i.e., variables will appear/disappear dynamically depending on the value of variable SERVER_CERTIFICATE_VERIFICATION

variable.name: PROVIDE_SERVER_CERTIFICATE_HANDLER
variable.description: A hidden variable that allows to have a dynamic form for input parameters, i.e., variables will appear/disappear dynamically depending on the value of variable SERVER_CERTIFICATE_VERIFICATION

variable.name: SERVER_CERTIFICATE_CRED
variable.description: Public Server SSL certificate

job.description: Workflow template composed of two tasks to Import /Export file(s) from/to an FTP server over SSL/TLS certificate.

task.name: Import_from_FTP_Server
task.description: This task allows to import locally (data space) files from an FTP server. The task requires the following third-party credential: {key: ftp://<username>@<hostname>, value: PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials.

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

variable.name: REMOTE_BASE
variable.description: A remote relative path on the FTP server from which we import file(s). $REMOTE_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. REMOTE/)

variable.name: LOCAL_BASE
variable.description: An absolute path or a relative path of a folder inside the Global Data Space in which the downloaded data will be stored. LOCAL_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. LOCAL/, /absolute/path/LOCAL/)

variable.name: MOVE_FILE
variable.description: If true, delete imported file(s) in the remote FTP server
If true, import only missing files
variable.name: SYNC_FILES

task.name: Export_to_FTP_Server
task.description: This task allows to export files to an FTP server. The task requires the following third-party credential: {key: ftp://<username>@<host>, value: PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials.

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

variable.name: REMOTE_BASE
variable.description: The remote relative path on the FTP server where exported file(s) will be stored. $REMOTE_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. REMOTE/)

variable.name: LOCAL_BASE
variable.description: An absolute path or a relative path of a folder inside the Global Data Space from which we export file(s) to the FTP server. LOCAL_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. LOCAL/, /absolute/path/LOCAL/)

variable.name: MOVE_FILE
variable.description: If true, delete imported file(s) in the remote FTP server

metadata.visualization:
Import_from_FTP_Server
 Export_to_FTP_Server
